ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Is it considered bad practice to perform HTTP POST without entity body?
ygData.msgSnippet: I would assume a POST or PUT would be ok, as they change some sort of state on the server side... or at least I would assume a trigger would require some

I would assume a POST or PUT would be ok, as they change some sort of state=
 on the server side... or at least I would assume a "trigger" would require=
 some sort of state change.

--- On Tue, 11/16/10, Suresh <sureshkk@gmail.c=
om> wrote:

From: Suresh <sureshkk@...>
Subject: [rest-discuss] Is it=
 considered bad practice to perform HTTP POST without entity body?
To: rest=
-discuss@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, November 16, 2010, 12:59 AM







=
=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      I need invoke a process which doesn=
't require any input from the user, just a trigger. I plan to use POST /uri=
 without body to trigger the process. I want to know if this is considered =
bad from both HTTP and REST perspective?





    
     

    
    


 



=
